page.title: 02Education in Cheddleton
page.content: At present there is a junior school on a split level site for 4 - 9 year olds with eight teachers. A middle school in a modified purpose built unit with five teachers, is being wound down prior to closure in 1986 and therefor only has three years of children. Both are controlled schools and cannot be altered without the consent of Lichfield diocese. Each school has its own board of Govenors. Overseas visits are run yearly to France and occasionally to Austria. On closure of the middle school the juniors will move into their building and plans are afoot to purchase the junior school for use as a village hall since the present Village Institute has been outgrown. St. Edwards Psychiatric Hospital has a School of Nursing.
